data.title: Best Location!
data.text: This is the perfect location if you want to enjoy historic downtown Waukesha.  It's located in the heart of the little downtown which has many restaurants, bars (some with live music too !), and shops.  Everything you could need is located right outside your door, including a bike shop where you can rent bicycles and connect right on to a trail that roams from the downtown area out through the suburbs in a park-like setting.  Such a great spot to stay!!!

data.title: Quirky & Quaint
data.text: The hotel check in is in the bar. So when the bar closes, the hotel locks the doors. We made it work, but it was a little like being in high school with a curfew. The staff was friendly and this is a great place to stay.

data.title: What a great find!
data.text: I stayed at The Clarke for a work trip and was pleasantly surprised. An overall great experience and downtown Waukesha is fantastic. David took excellent care of us and treated each person as if they were his only customer! What a great hotel!

data.title: Quaint, boutique hotel with character
data.text:
From the building to the hospitality of David, the Clarke hotel is a gem.

I travel for work,but this is also a great getaway hotel. I only wish the shops and stay open a bit later. 

The food is very accommodating, even if you are a vegan,passing through the cheese state.

data.title: Wedding Rehearsal Dinner venue
data.text:
We stayed in almost all the rooms as well as holding our wedding rehearsal dinner here. 

The rooms are unique - each one is a different size and shape - and each one I saw was huge! The bathrooms are well appointed with great showers and tubs and everything was really clean. I'd definitely stay here again!

Our event was done well with some glitches that could have been avoided with a point person in attendance - the meal was very late and the salad and dessert never arrived. 

The food we did get was good and the room was nicely was a good experience

data.title: Beauty and the Beast
data.text: The Clarke has "charm" but it needs to pay more attention to the "housekeeping" details that keep patrons faithful to it.  There was nothing "major", but enough to be annoying. First, we had requested a room with two beds and got a room with a king bed. Two girlfriends on a getaway weekend - really wants TWO beds. Other standouts - the coffee maker didn't work, there were not enough towels and NO washcloths, one of the coffee cups still had lipstick on the rim from someone else! Ewww! In fairness, Brian fixed what he could, apologized for what he couldn't and personally delivered a pot of coffee both days. A true ambassador for the hotel. Thank you Brian. One other thing- avoid Room 205 if you can. Very, very noisy as it is a room located facing a busy street and the noise goes on alllllllll night. We will give The Clarke another try and hope for adequate towels, washcloths, a coffee maker that works and   clean cups. Please don't let easy fixes ruin The Clarke!

data.title: Nice Sunday Evening Stay
data.text:
What a beautiful historic classically shaped building. Built late 1800s. It seems the beautiful Waukesha downtown has maintained many of the original historic buildings near the Fox River. 

Check-in on the first floor, all rooms on the second floor which has a couple of levels. The hotel is maintained and been updated very nicely.

Our room had to walk down a half flight of stairs to get to. A big room with a desk, couch, chair with an ottoman that opens with a laptop desk, king bed with lots of pillows.

The bathroom has all Kohler updates. The bathtub shower room separated by a glass door. Unusual design, shower for two. Very well done.

Staff very helpful, both on the phone and during our stay.

Breakfast - has premade quiches in ramekins, sausage & bacon to heat up in microwave - delicious! Instant oatmeal, bagels, English muffins, fruit, muffins, yogurt, oj, coffee, etc.  All fresh, delicious and a good selection.

A couple of suggestions to get 5/5, the room carpet had many stains, likely cannot change the loud HVAC system. Had a nice cool evening so opened windows vs AC turning on and off.

Enjoyed our stay. Do recommend if you're looking for a hotel with ambiance vs a franchise in Waukesha, stay here!

data.title: Work Trip Stay
data.text:
I stayed at the Clarke hotel for a work meeting hosted in Waukesha. I enjoyed staying at a smaller hotel that wasn't affiliated with a large multi-national chain. 

The front door staff was friendly and helped guide me through the twisted hallways to my room on the third floor. The room itself wasn't extremely memorable, the bathroom was probably the most unique part of the hotel having a very elaborate shower that was lovely.

The parking lot of the hotel isn't directly connected to the building and is down the street and around a corner so if mobility is an issue make sure that you are dropped off and someone assists with your bags. 

Overall a nice little hotel that I would recommend to anyone who will be passing through the Waukesha area and looking for a place to stay.

data.title: Beautiful old hotel - right on Main Street
data.text:
This was a lovely place to stay.  We had what we found out was the 'Honeymoon Suite' that was so pretty!  The room was huge by modern standards with about 8 windows onto the streets below - very large bathroom (had to ask for extra towels; was set up for only 1 person?); however, that request was promptly handled.  Very soft, snuggly robes supplied in the closet.  (Noticed a couple of items that needed repair; however, at checkout we were informed that updates and repairs were ongoing in several rooms - not unusual for an older hotel).

What was ideal was the Irish bar and Restaurant on the bottom floor of the Hotel.  That was an unexpected delightful surprise.  The bartender also served our delicious dinner.  
For a Sunday night, there were mainly locals in the bar and it was all one could hope for in the type of place we were sure  'everyone knows your name'.  Excellent ambiance supplied by a jazz guitarist.  All in all, it was a very lovely evening and overnight stay.

My husband was working and I was allowed an extra hour to check out the following morning - very accommodating.

data.title: Excellent
data.text: The only negative thing I have to say is the noise from the street over night.  Bikes and peoples.  My room was just ahead.  But with the A.C. on it is not a big deal.   The staff was very helpful and the restaurant very good. I would go in again.

data.title: Nice weekday visit
data.text:
We had a corner room and loved the view of downtown Waukesha. The large bathroom and large walk-in shower were excellent and bed was very comfortable. Staff was pleasant and helpful, although we were disappointed that the DVD player we had requested in advance became a problem.
The complimentary breakfast was very good. But parking is a bit of an issue, and with no fitness center or pool, guests needed passes for a gym several miles away. And the hotel computer for guest use was worthless. And although our room was air conditioned and comfortable, the hallways were not.

data.title: Independently Comfortable
data.text: The Clarke Hotel is located in the heart of downtown Waukesha, WI. The hotel has a very comfortable feel and staff is very personable.  The entry to the hotel is located at street level and immediately next to the Irish Pub portion of the property. All of the rooms were oversized in floor space. Each room has a Keurig coffee maker, mini fridge and plenty of bathroom amenities. There is an elevator that services only the 2nd floor. Our initial reservation was for a 3rd floor room, but upon check-in we inquired able the possibility of relocating to a 2nd floor room due to an injury. Our request was taken care of and was greatly appreciated. There is a continental breakfast available in the morning and if need the full bar can provide an adult beverage if necessary.  There are multiple restaurants and shops within walking distance.  There is also a terrific series of walking paths and trails close by for exercise. We are already talking about our return visit to the Clarke.

data.title: I very much enjoyed my stay at The Clarke Hotel
data.text: I gave The Clarke Hotel another try and it was a positive experience this time. The two bedroom suite was very nice. I had a great time with friends in downtown Waukesha for the Friday night Band's event activities. The Hotel's location was perfect for my needs. The staff was very nice and helpful. I am sure that I will stay at the The Clarke Hotel again in the future.

data.title: Great hotel
data.text:
A native of Waukesha I was looking for a quiet place to stay while I was home visiting family. My room was perfect in every way. The tubs are jacuzzi style. The showers are great. The beds!!!!!  Crazy amazing. A lot of work went into this unique hotel. Location is great. Spend your Friday nights walking the streets of Waukesha listing to live music. 

All and all great location and great hotel

data.title: very unique stop on the path of life
data.text: This was a three or four but really in between the two.I really enjoyed the quirkiness of the Clarke.It probably isnt for everybodybut overall I would stay again.The shower and the bed were favorites parts but the high ceilings and windows were cool..The hotel and room felt worn but in a good sort of way..Our prices were fair and the location took us to some neat places like Hannons...the resale shop called Pinkys?..Daddy O's...Loads of Irish Pubs nearby..Shuttle to Milwaukee a few miles away was helpful...The air conditioner was noisy but I have had worse in fancier spots.Breakfast from 7 to 9 am not good for me bcause I am a night owl.Should be longer..Oh well..A fun stop..

data.title: Beautiful hotel
data.text: Great hotel on the main strip downtown! Beautiful rooms and great bartender at the pub in the bar-thanks David! The hallways smelled a little, but the rooms were worth it and no smell in the rooms.  All the amenities! Great place to stay if in Waukesha!!

data.title: Great Stay from Alpine Valley
data.text:
This is a great little hotel for those who like to see a show at Alpine Valley but don't want to camp! Hotel is very clean, rooms are large, and staff is friendly. Added bonus is the hotel is locked later in the evening so it's safe too. 

Only thing that needs a little improving is the breakfast. The food tasted good but we had to re-heat it all up ourselves and the choices were limited. The hotel also doesn't having vending.

Would stay again!

data.title: Unique Hotel
data.text: No chain type hotel here.Very nice,everything from this 20 room hotel is unique,from the continental breakfast in the irish pub with individual quiches to the room set up.The rooms have really comfortable king size beds with high quality bedding and lots of pillows,best sleep ever for all of us we had 2 rooms.1 room had 2 bedrooms each with a king bed nightstands and lamps and a tv and closet.Room had a large dressser,coffemaker and mini fridge and a large bathroom with a huge kohler body jet shower that is awesome.The 2nd room was for 6 people with 1 bedroom with 2 king beds same great beds and bedding with a living room with pullout couch and 2 chairs with tv in bedroom and iving room,same large dresser and coffeemaker and fridge and shower.There is a commons area on 2nd floor with couches,microwave and icemaker and elevator is very unique.The downtown area is very cool lots of  bars and restaurants with free music and original type shops and a farmers market on satuday morning that is very nice.

data.title: Downtown Waukesha gem
data.text: The quaint hotel is located right in downtown along side the bars, restaurants and fun. Hotel rooms are spacious and very clean. Irish pub located on the main floor has a very European flavor. Complimentary, hot morning breakfast was great. Staff has a very welcoming attitude.

data.title: It's the Little things!
data.text: We picked this hotel for a weekend get-a-way because we love their sister hotels..Chateau DePere and St. Brendans in Green Bay. It's the little things that will give you a bad review.  1st was all the construction around the hotel..messy, and a pain for parking. The room was large, but very boring! Really could use some art work on all those big brown walls. There was no clock in the room (we do not have smart phones attached to our faces 24/7. We were 2 people...there was only one washcloth..1 bar of soap (so now you have to keep transferring it from the shower to the sink..nice Keurig coffee machine..however only 1 pod of coffee..with no stir sticks to stir the coffee! So I look for a paper and pen to write all this down, and you guessed it..none in the room!  Wrote it all down with stuff from my purse and gave it to the manager in the morning..who assured me it would all be taken care of...oops..almost for forgot the burned out light bulb (the one between the 2 chairs where you would read. Went shopping for the afrernoon..came back, and not one thing was changed!! We got a bartender to find us a light bulb...he said they're switching over to LED ones next week. OK..enough..just know we were very disappointed, and probably won't return.
